paws 0.1.6

Modifies the Availability Zone, instance count, instance type, or network platform (EC2-Classic or EC2-VPC) of your Reserved Instances

Source: R/ec2_operations.R
ec2_modify_reserved_instances.Rd

Modifies the Availability Zone, instance count, instance type, or network platform (EC2-Classic or EC2-VPC) of your Reserved Instances. The Reserved Instances to be modified must be identical, except for Availability Zone, network platform, and instance type.

ec2_modify_reserved_instances(ReservedInstancesIds, ClientToken,
  TargetConfigurations)

Arguments

ReservedInstancesIds

[required] The IDs of the Reserved Instances to modify.
ClientToken

A unique, case-sensitive token you provide to ensure idempotency of your modification request. For more information, see Ensuring Idempotency.
TargetConfigurations

[required] The configuration settings for the Reserved Instances to modify.

Details

For more information, see Modifying Reserved Instances in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide.

Request syntax

svc$modify_reserved_instances(
  ReservedInstancesIds = list(
    "string"
  ),
  ClientToken = "string",
  TargetConfigurations = list(
    list(
      AvailabilityZone = "string",
      InstanceCount = 123,
      InstanceType =
